Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2010 02:39PM MagentaMoment wrote: Beesie, Thank you soooo very much for your post. Our heads are literally spinning around and its so difficult to wrap your brain around all of this information. I suppose with that said though.. it makes me question the false negatives that can result from a mammo. The lumps were noticed and created the need for further testing. If the lumps were not present then these masses would have continued undetected. It may a bit concern seeing that I am scheduled for my mammo next Wednesday and can only pray the a negative mammo is indeed that. Uh... it seems so much. Thank you again.
